identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Saffety of Oral Immunotherapy to Pistachio
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy of Oral Immunotherapy to Pistachio in Children on the Oral Tolerance to Pistachio and Cashew Nuts

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The objectives of this study are (i) to evaluate the efficacy of oral immunotherapy to pistachio by evaluating the daily oral tolerance of 2g pistachio, by evaluating the long-term tolerance of 15g pistachio (sustained unresponsiveness) and by decreasing pistachio-specific IgE, (ii) evaluating the efficacy of pistachio immunotherapy on cashew tolerance, (iii) and to evaluate the safety of pistachio immunotherapy.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Absence of moderate to severe allergic reactions
primaryOutcomes.description: with daily intake of 2g of pistachio

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Frequency and severity of allergic reactions
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the dose escalation phase and during the maintenance phase (first 6 months, 1st year, 2nd year, 3rd year)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Decrease in specific IgE and increase of IGg4 to pistachio
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the dose escalation phase and during the maintenance phase (first 6 months, 1st year, 2nd year, 3rd year)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Tolerance of 1, 2, 4, 8g in isolated doses and 15 g in total cumulative dose of pistachio
secondaryOutcomes.description: during an oral pistachio challenge test
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 months after stopping daily consumption of 2g pistachio

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Tolerance of 1, 2, 4, 8g in isolated doses and 15 g in total cumulative dose of cashew nut
secondaryOutcomes.description: during an oral cashew nut challenge test
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 months after stopping daily consumption of 2g pistachio

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Reactogenic or tolerogenic threshold of cashew nuts
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the dose escalation phase and during the maintenance phase (first 6 months, 1st year, 2nd year, 3rd year)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients under 18 years of age with a proven allergy to pistachio and followed in the pediatric allergology unit of the Nancy University Hospital.
* Patients who have received oral immunotherapy to pistachio for at least 18 months at 31/12/2022

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who have received oral immunotherapy to pistachio for less than 18 months.
* Patients lost to follow-up for more than 2 years or last consultation dating from 2020 or earlier
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients meeting the inclusion criteria (between 10 and 50)
